unittitle_ssm: Saretta G. Hicks papers on Lady Deborah Moody
abstract_ssm: This collection consists of papers gathered and, in many cases, written by author Saretta G. Hicks during the period 1963 to 1965.  The material includes her notes and research for an unfinished book about Lady Deborah Moody titled Dangerous Woman: A Biography of Deborah, Lady Moody of Coney Island.  Lady Moody is best known as the founder of the town of Gravesend in what was then New Amsterdam and later became a part of Brooklyn, N.Y.  Of particular note is the inclusion of copies of original documents pertaining to Lady Moody's family history.  There is also a four-page typed transcript of Gravesend town meeting records from 1656.
